result.execSummary:
The defendant James Arthur Neal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of EXtended vision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed under probation conditions. Exception is no condition time for ES period.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and DNA surcharge is mandatory and assessed if not already done.
Payment of the surcharges, costs, fees are to be collected by DOC from all applicable prison funds and wages, in an amount or a percentage which the Department determines is reasonable, as welll as during any applicable period of Extended sueprvision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Payment must be made by the end of probation  period.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: Forthwith.  Huber release privileges for treatment, health needs including release for treatment of cancer issues, if necessary transport to treatment facility for treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Arthur Neal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet

Defendant James Arthur Neal in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sidebar.  Side bar put on the record.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 2 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months.

The Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.  

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH.  Huber release privileges for Treatment, Health needs including release for treatment of cancer issues, if necessary transport to treatment facility for treatment.  
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).  

- DNA sample and DNA surcharge is mandatory and assessed if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Payment of the surcharges, costs, fees are to be collected by the DOC from all applicable prison funds and wages, in an amount or a percentage which the Department determines is reasonable, as well as during any applicable period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment - payment must be made by the end of period of probation.  
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant James Arthur Neal in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Defendant would like to proceed with a projected guilty plea.  Defendant sworn.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Oral corrections made to the criminal complaint.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant James Arthur Neal in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant James Arthur Neal in custody.  Ron Dague for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
